sermons.title: "Ye shall be as gods.Â”  That was not ChristÂ’s ambition
sermons.description: The Bible says, â€œExamine yourselves.â€  That doesnâ€™t mean that I should examine somebody else.  Itâ€™s a bad, bad sign when I examine everybody elseâ€”shows that I havenâ€™t seen myself, I have lost sight of my own great need.  You know, thatâ€™s the mark of true Christian.  He examines himself in the presence of God and he judges no man.  Jesus was like that.  But it would be good, and it is good, and it must be good for us to examine ourselves, or to let God examine us.  â€œExamine yourselves, whether ye be in the faith, whether Christ be in you.â€ Iâ€™ve been sitting here praying for this one thing: that God might help in these days for us to see our great need.  What is our need?  Well, weâ€™re a perishing lotâ€”perishing.  â€œWoe is me.  I am undone.  Iâ€™m a man of unclean lips, and I dwell among a people of unclean lips.â€  Iâ€™m in a poisonous atmosphere.  â€œWho shall deliver me from the body of this death?â€  Thereâ€™s no deliverance except the thing that our brother spoke of: to be made new, absolutely new.  As long as we try to fix up the old, weâ€™ll only make an awful job out of it.  But, oh, if Jesus Christ has His way, heâ€™ll go His wayâ€”we will go His way.  And His way is just one way: â€œLearn of Me.  I am meek and lowly in heart.â€  Oh, is that my desire?

sermons.title: (Australia) Offended in Christ
sermons.description: he enemy is speaking to John: "Why are you in prison? Why is Jesus so Passive? John is becoming offended by Christ. The enemy attacks us the same way.  Are you offended by Christ? We pray and doubt that God can hear us, or answer our prayers. so we have unfulfilled expectations. God responds to us, "You are offended by the way I am bringing about my kingdom" You have need of patience after you have done the will of the father to receive the promise. David Wilkerson says, "I am so glad that God didn't answer my prayers in the way that I asked him! I would not be here!"  One thing that John did well, was to take his doubts to Jesus.  Jesus reaffirmed him of who he was and pressed him further, "...blessed is he who is not offended because of me"

sermons.title: A Friend of Sinners
sermons.description: April 30, 2006. When we allow envy and jealousy to lodge in our hear we are apt to monitor the sins of others while we justify ourselves. The bible says every man will answer for their own actions. We must bear one anothers burdens, not thinking too highly of ourselves and so fulfill the law of Christ. Filfilling the law of Christ is loving God and our neighbors as ourselves.

sermons.title: Blessedness of the Unoffended
sermons.description: The date delivered was 05/01/1959. This message brings to light the stories of Elijah and Elisha, as well as John the Baptist. It is easy to become offended at God when He moves in ways that we do not expect -- especially if He does not seem to be moving at all! But, our heart's cry should be to know Him.  If this is the case, we will never be offended, no matter how "forgotten" we feel. Even our master Jesus exclaimed many times through the gospels 'blessed is he who is not offended in me'.

sermons.title: Hell, What Is It Like?
sermons.description: This is a very sobering message on the reality of hell. Barely any preachers these days would even dare to preach on this subject but how sad that falls from the new testament normal of hell as a normal doctrine taught and discussed. Jesus spoke of hell more then heaven, listen carefully and know that there is a eternal hell.

sermons.title: IT'S WORTH IT!
sermons.description: In hours of despair does everything seems to fall apart? Perhaps difficult circumstances oppress you and life with certain people becomes unbearable? Do you feel you'd like to give up and throw everything away? Then listen to this meditation: IT'S WORTH IT. Kanaan is the home of the Evangelical Sisterhood of Mary, an international, interdenominational organization founded in 1947 within the framework of the German Evangelical (Protestant) Church. Website: www.kanaan.org

sermons.title: Matthew - Part 2
sermons.description: The grand theme of Matthew is a new covenant people who set their minds on heavenly things, not the things of earth.  The kingdom of heaven is likened to humble children; to these kinds of disciples does revelation and the glory of Christ come.  Zac touches upon many precious comparisons that abound in this gospel.

sermons.title: Offended In Christ
sermons.description: The evidence of unbelief sprouting is that we no longer pray for what we once believed God for. The devil will come at us and try to rob us from the confidence we have in the promises of God. Jesus said “blessed is He that is not offended in Him” One of the most destructive devises of the devil is to trap and convince us of who Christ is and who we are in Christ so that we become offended with the ways of God.

sermons.title: Outline & Resume of So Great Salvation
THE OFFER OF LOWLINESS
sermons.description: God can totally change and transform peoples' lives, if only they let Him. Would you like your life to be different? Would you like to see some changes in the people around you? This meditation will tell what you can do to bring about these changes.

sermons.title: The Blood, the Call, the Promise
sermons.description: A very clear presentation of the Gospel. Brother David wants to leave no doubt, but that everyone under the sound of his voice gets a simple understanding of the blood of Jesus, the power of the call and the promise that is ours, as we respond.

sermons.title: Violent Men
sermons.description: How to take the Kingdom of Heaven – a call to lay hold of life directed to college students in the spring of 2005.

sermons.title: Who Are the Meek and What Do They Inherit
sermons.description: Very good message defining the importance of "meekness." "Meekness is not weakness." This is a must hear sermon by Carter Conlon on meekness.  The heart of the message is about the need for each of us to walk in meekness in order to lead others to Jesus.  The meek man Moses could not lead the children into the promised land, because of one instance of anger.  There is a warning to us in this example.  We can miss the opportunity to lead family, friends, and others to the Lord by one instance of walking out of the character of Christ.  Carter used Mathew 11:28 when Jesus said, “I am meek and lowly of heart.”  Carter also used Mathew 5 Jesus said, “blessed are the meek” but the main text he used was the story of Moses hitting the rock in anger and the inability of Moses to then lead others into the promised land.
